Common questions about gooseneck and sci: Common questions about gooseneck and scimitar press brake tooling
A gooseneck punch features a deep relief: A gooseneck punch features a deep relief design (offset profile) that provides clearance for existing flanges and deep box geometries. Standard straight 90° punches would cause interference when trying to form channels or parts with return flanges. Gooseneck punches enable multi-bend operations by preventing the punch from hitting previously formed flanges, making them essential for box forming, door frames, and channel bending applications.
\"Scimitar\" or \"saber\" refers to an o: "Scimitar" or "saber" refers to an offset, curved profile design similar to the curved blade of a scimitar sword. In press brake tooling, scimitar punches feature an offset geometry that allows for complex channel formations and Z-bends. When combined with gooseneck design, it creates a specialized tool providing both deep relief clearance and offset capability for the most challenging box and channel forming operations.
Throat depth should be determined by the: Throat depth should be determined by the return flange length you need to form. Measure the distance from the bend line to the edge of your existing flange, then add clearance (typically 3-5mm). For channels formed in two strokes, the throat depth determines the maximum channel depth. Provide us with your part drawings showing flange dimensions, and our engineering team will recommend the optimal throat depth and face width for your application.
Yes, acute angle gooseneck punches (30°,: Yes, acute angle gooseneck punches (30°, 45°, 60°) are specifically designed for hemming and acute bending operations where deep relief clearance is required. These combine the interference-free benefits of gooseneck design with sharp tip geometry for hemming. Two-stage hemming operations (acute bend followed by flattening) can be performed even on parts with existing flanges using specialized gooseneck hemming tooling.
Standard gooseneck punches are manufactu: Standard gooseneck punches are manufactured from T10A, 42CrMo, or Cr12MoV alloy steel with quenching hardness of HRC 47±2. This hardness provides excellent wear resistance while maintaining toughness to prevent cracking in the deep relief geometry. For high-volume production or hard materials (stainless steel, high-tensile steel), optional induction hardening or Nitrex® surface treatment can increase surface hardness while maintaining core toughness.
Absolutely. We specialize in custom-engi: Absolutely. We specialize in custom-engineered gooseneck punches designed to your exact specifications. Provide part drawings showing flange dimensions, bend angles, material specifications, and production volume. Our engineering team will design custom gooseneck tooling optimized for your specific application, including unique throat depths, compound angles, radius bends, or specialized clearance features. Custom tooling is particularly cost-effective for high-volume production of proprietary box and channel designs.
Get comprehensive technical specificatio: Get comprehensive technical specifications, throat depth selection charts, application guides, and dimensional drawings for our complete range of gooseneck and scimitar press brake tooling.
